events.title: Adoption of the Declaration of Independence by New York
events.description: Although the United States Declaration of Independence was adopted on July 4, 1776, New York's Provincial Congress formally ratified it on July 9, 1776, affirming the colony's commitment to independence.
events.significance: Marked New York's official break from British rule and solidarity with the other thirteen colonies.

events.title: California becomes the 31st U.S. state
events.description: California was admitted to the Union as the 31st state on July 9, 1850, following the Gold Rush and rapid population growth.
events.significance: Significantly expanded United States territory and influenced the balance between free and slave states.

events.title: The Stradivarius violin 'Messiah' is completed
events.description: Antonio Stradivari completed the 'Messiah' violin, considered one of the finest and best-preserved violins ever made.
events.significance: Represents the pinnacle of violin craftsmanship and continues to influence musicians and luthiers.

events.title: The Great Flood of 1993 begins in the U.S.
events.description: Heavy rains led to one of the most devastating floods in U.S. history along the Mississippi and Missouri Rivers, starting around July 9, 1993.
events.significance: Caused widespread damage, displacement, and prompted improvements in flood management policies.
